snippet: When baseball retired Jackie Robinson’s No. 42 in 1997, the 13 major leaguers with No. 42 were allowed to keep wearing it. Mariano Rivera will be the last.
abstract: New York Yankees pitcher Mariano Rivera, who is retiring after the 2013 season, will be the last player in Major League Baseball wearing Jackie Robinson's No 42, which was retired on April 15, 1997, 50th anniversary of Robinson's first game in the majors, game in which he broke the sport's color barrier.
lead_paragraph: When baseball retired Jackie Robinson’s No. 42 in 1997, the 13 major leaguers with No. 42 were allowed to keep wearing it. Mariano Rivera will be the last.

headline.seo: Mariano Rivera Wearing Jackie Robinson’s 42 to the End
headline.main: Rivera Is Taking Robinson’s 42 to Its Last Stop
headline.print_headline: Rivera Is Taking Robinson’s 42 To Its Last Stop
